title: SYSTEM MESSAGE: CONTEXT INJECTION FOR LLM
text: Signature: Description: Computes standardized mean difference 2x2 factorial designs. type argument controls whether independent, main, interaction effects computed. Arguments: | Argument | Type | Required | Default | Description | |——————–|————–|———-|—————-|——————————————————————–| | type | string | Yes | | Effect type: “ind”, “main”, “inter” | | data | data.frame | Yes | | Data frame input data | | col_names | character[2] | | c(“yi”,“vi”) | Names output columns | | append | logical | | TRUE | Append results input data? | | hedges_correction | logical | | TRUE | Apply Hedges’ correction small-sample bias | | Ctrl_mean | numeric | Yes | | Mean control group | | Ctrl_sd | numeric | Yes | | SD control group | | Ctrl_n | integer | Yes | | Sample size control group | | A_mean | numeric | Yes | | Mean group | | A_sd | numeric | Yes | | SD group | | A_n | integer | Yes | | Sample size group | | B_mean | numeric | | NULL | Mean B group (main/inter ) | | B_sd | numeric | | NULL | SD B group | | B_n | integer | | NULL | Sample size B group | | AB_mean | numeric | | NULL | Mean AB group (main/inter ) | | AB_sd | numeric | | NULL | SD AB group | | AB_n | integer | | NULL | Sample size AB group | Returns: data.frame columns effect size variance (default: yi, vi). Wrappers: - SMD_ind(...) — computes independent effect - SMD_main(...) — computes main effect - SMD_inter(...) — computes interaction effect Example:
code: SMD(   type,   data,   col_names = c("yi", "vi"),   append = TRUE,   hedges_correction = TRUE,   Ctrl_mean,   Ctrl_sd,   Ctrl_n,   A_mean,   A_sd,   A_n,   B_mean = NULL,   B_sd = NULL,   B_n = NULL,   AB_mean = NULL,   AB_sd = NULL,   AB_n = NULL ) result <- SMD(   type = "main",   data = my_data,   Ctrl_mean = C_mean, Ctrl_sd = C_sd, Ctrl_n = C_n,   A_mean = A_mean, A_sd = A_sd, A_n = A_n,   B_mean = B_mean, B_sd = B_sd, B_n = B_n,   AB_mean = AB_mean, AB_sd = AB_sd, AB_n = AB_n )

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Effect sizes factorial meta-analysis first introduced Gurevitch et al. (2000), presented methods estimating main interaction effects analogous factorial ANOVA. Originally developed Standardized Mean Difference, approaches extended effect size families including response ratios variability measures. Recent developments Shinichi Nakagawa Daniel Noble expanded methods include lnVR lnCVR effect sizes, providing researchers comprehensive tools meta-analyzing factorial experiments.

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Standardized Mean Difference measures magnitude treatment effects standard deviation units, making comparable across studies different measurement scales.

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Computes individual simple effect Factor compared Control. equivalent classic SMD can computed using metafor’s escalc() function measure = "SMD". Formula: dind=X‾−X‾CtrlSpooled⋅J(m)d_{ind} = \frac{\bar{X}_A - \bar{X}_{Ctrl}}{S_{pooled}} \cdot J(m) pooled standard deviation : Spooled=(nA−1)sdA2+(nCtrl−1)sdCtrl2nA+nCtrl−2S_{pooled} = \sqrt{\frac{(n_A-1)sd_A^2 + (n_{Ctrl}-1)sd_{Ctrl}^2}{n_A + n_{Ctrl} - 2}} Small-sample bias correction: J(m)J(m) correction (Hedges correction) applied default can disabled: J(m)=1−34m−1J(m) = 1 - \frac{3}{4m-1} m=nA+nCtrl−2m = n_A + n_{Ctrl} - 2 Sampling variance: var(dind)=1nA+1nCtrl+d22(nA+nCtrl)var(d_{ind}) = \frac{1}{n_A} + \frac{1}{n_{Ctrl}} + \frac{d^2}{2(n_A + n_{Ctrl})}

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Computes main effect Factor averaged across levels Factor B, analogous main effects factorial ANOVA. Formula: dmain=(X‾+X‾AB)−(X‾B+X‾Ctrl)2Spooled⋅J(m)d_{main} = \frac{(\bar{X}_A + \bar{X}_{AB}) - (\bar{X}_{B} + \bar{X}_{Ctrl})}{2S_{pooled}} \cdot J(m) Pooled standard deviation (four groups): Spooled=(nA−1)sdA2+(nB−1)sdB2+(nAB−1)sdAB2+(nCtrl−1)sdCtrl2nA+nB+nAB+nCtrl−4S_{pooled} = \sqrt{\frac{(n_A-1)sd_A^2 + (n_B-1)sd_B^2 + (n_{AB}-1)sd_{AB}^2 + (n_{Ctrl}-1)sd_{Ctrl}^2}{n_A + n_B + n_{AB} + n_{Ctrl} - 4}} Degrees freedom: m=nA+nB+nAB+nCtrl−4m = n_A + n_B + n_{AB} + n_{Ctrl} - 4 Sampling variance: var(dmain)=14(1nA+1nB+1nAB+1nCtrl+dmain22(nA+nB+nAB+nCtrl))var(d_{main}) = \frac{1}{4} \left(\frac{1}{n_A} + \frac{1}{n_B} + \frac{1}{n_{AB}} + \frac{1}{n_{Ctrl}} + \frac{d_{main}^2}{2(n_A + n_B + n_{AB} + n_{Ctrl})}\right)

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Computes interaction factors B, measuring effect depends level B. Formula: dinter=(X‾AB−X‾B)−(X‾−X‾Ctrl)Spooled⋅J(m)d_{inter} = \frac{(\bar{X}_{AB} - \bar{X}_B) - (\bar{X}_A - \bar{X}_{Ctrl})}{S_{pooled}} \cdot J(m) Uses four-group pooled standard deviation main effect. Sampling variance: var(dinter)=1nA+1nB+1nAB+1nCtrl+dinter22(nA+nB+nAB+nCtrl)var(d_{inter}) = \frac{1}{n_A} + \frac{1}{n_B} + \frac{1}{n_{AB}} + \frac{1}{n_{Ctrl}} + \frac{d_{inter}^2}{2(n_A + n_B + n_{AB} + n_{Ctrl})}

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Log Response Ratio measures proportional changes treatments, providing intuitive interpretation.

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Formula: lnRRind=ln(X‾AX‾Ctrl)\ln RR_{ind} = \ln\left(\frac{\bar{X}_A}{\bar{X}_{Ctrl}}\right) Sampling variance: var(lnRRind)=sdA2nAX‾A2+sdCtrl2nCtrlX‾Ctrl2var(\ln RR_{ind}) = \frac{sd_A^2}{n_A\bar{X}_A^2} + \frac{sd_{Ctrl}^2}{n_{Ctrl}\bar{X}_{Ctrl}^2}

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Formula: lnRRmain=ln(X‾+X‾ABX‾Ctrl+X‾B)\ln RR_{main} = \ln\left(\frac{\bar{X}_A + \bar{X}_{AB}}{\bar{X}_{Ctrl} + \bar{X}_B}\right) Sampling variance: var(lnRRmain)=(1X‾+X‾AB)2(sdA2nA+sdAB2nAB)+(1X‾Ctrl+X‾B)2(sdCtrl2nCtrl+sdB2nB)var(\ln RR_{main}) = \left(\frac{1}{\bar{X}_A + \bar{X}_{AB}}\right)^2 \left(\frac{sd_A^2}{n_A} + \frac{sd_{AB}^2}{n_{AB}}\right) + \left(\frac{1}{\bar{X}_{Ctrl} + \bar{X}_B}\right)^2 \left(\frac{sd_{Ctrl}^2}{n_{Ctrl}} + \frac{sd_B^2}{n_B}\right)

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Formula: lnRRinter=ln(X‾ABX‾B)−ln(X‾AX‾Ctrl)\ln RR_{inter} = \ln\left(\frac{\bar{X}_{AB}}{\bar{X}_B}\right) - \ln\left(\frac{\bar{X}_A}{\bar{X}_{Ctrl}}\right) Sampling variance: var(lnRRinter)=sdAB2nABX‾AB2+sdA2nAX‾A2+sdB2nBX‾B2+sdCtrl2nCtrlX‾Ctrl2var(\ln RR_{inter}) = \frac{sd_{AB}^2}{n_{AB}\bar{X}_{AB}^2} + \frac{sd_A^2}{n_A\bar{X}_A^2} + \frac{sd_B^2}{n_B\bar{X}_B^2} + \frac{sd_{Ctrl}^2}{n_{Ctrl}\bar{X}_{Ctrl}^2}

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Log Variation Ratio compares variability treatments, providing insights treatments affect response consistency.

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Formula: lnVRind=ln(sdAsdCtrl)+12(nA−1)−12(nCtrl−1)\ln VR_{ind} = \ln\left(\frac{sd_{}}{sd_{Ctrl}}\right) + \frac{1}{2(n_{} - 1)} - \frac{1}{2(n_{Ctrl} - 1)} Sampling variance: var(lnVRind)=12(nA−1)+12(nCtrl−1)var(\ln VR_{ind}) = \frac{1}{2(n_{} - 1)} + \frac{1}{2(n_{Ctrl} - 1)}

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Formula: lnVRmain=12ln(sdAB⋅sdAsdB⋅sdCtrl)+12(12(nAB−1)+12(nA−1)−12(nB−1)−12(nCtrl−1))\ln VR_{main} = \frac{1}{2} \ln\left( \frac{sd_{AB} \cdot sd_{}}{sd_{B} \cdot sd_{Ctrl}} \right) + \frac{1}{2} \left( \frac{1}{2(n_{AB} - 1)} + \frac{1}{2(n_{} - 1)} - \frac{1}{2(n_{B} - 1)} - \frac{1}{2(n_{Ctrl} - 1)} \right) Sampling variance: var(lnVRmain)=14(12(nAB−1)+12(nA−1)+12(nB−1)+12(nCtrl−1))var(\ln VR_{main}) = \frac{1}{4} \left( \frac{1}{2(n_{AB} - 1)} + \frac{1}{2(n_{} - 1)} + \frac{1}{2(n_{B} - 1)} + \frac{1}{2(n_{Ctrl} - 1)} \right)

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Formula: lnVRinter=ln(sdAB/sdBsdA/sdCtrl)+12(nAB−1)−12(nA−1)−12(nB−1)+12(nCtrl−1)\ln VR_{inter} = \ln\left( \frac{sd_{AB} / sd_{B}}{sd_{} / sd_{Ctrl}} \right) + \frac{1}{2(n_{AB} - 1)} - \frac{1}{2(n_{} - 1)} - \frac{1}{2(n_{B} - 1)} + \frac{1}{2(n_{Ctrl} - 1)} Sampling variance: var(lnVRinter)=12(nAB−1)+12(nA−1)+12(nB−1)+12(nCtrl−1)var(\ln VR_{inter}) = \frac{1}{2(n_{AB} - 1)} + \frac{1}{2(n_{} - 1)} + \frac{1}{2(n_{B} - 1)} + \frac{1}{2(n_{Ctrl} - 1)}

text: Log Coefficient Variation Ratio combines information mean responses variability comparing coefficients variation (CV=sd/x‾CV = sd / \bar{x}).

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Formula: lnCVRind=ln(CVACVCtrl)+12(nA−1)−12(nCtrl−1)\ln CVR_{ind} = \ln\left( \frac{CV_{}}{CV_{Ctrl}} \right) + \frac{1}{2(n_{} - 1)} - \frac{1}{2(n_{Ctrl} - 1)} Sampling variance: var(lnCVRind)=sdCtrl2nCtrlX‾Ctrl2+12(nCtrl−1)+sdA2nAX‾A2+12(nA−1)var(\ln CVR_{ind}) = \frac{sd_{Ctrl}^2}{n_{Ctrl}\bar{X}_{Ctrl}^2} + \frac{1}{2(n_{Ctrl} - 1)} + \frac{sd_A^2}{n_A\bar{X}_A^2} + \frac{1}{2(n_A - 1)} assumes correlation mean variance (Nakagawa et al. 2015) computed sum lnRR lnVR variances.

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Formula: lnCVRmain=12ln(CVAB⋅CVACVB⋅CVCtrl)+12(12(nAB−1)+12(nA−1)−12(nB−1)−12(nCtrl−1))\ln CVR_{main} = \frac{1}{2} \ln\left( \frac{CV_{AB} \cdot CV_{}}{CV_{B} \cdot CV_{Ctrl}} \right) + \frac{1}{2} \left( \frac{1}{2(n_{AB} - 1)} + \frac{1}{2(n_{} - 1)} - \frac{1}{2(n_{B} - 1)} - \frac{1}{2(n_{Ctrl} - 1)} \right) Sampling variance: var(lnCVRmain)=var(lnRRmain)+var(lnVRmain)var(\ln CVR_{main}) = var(\ln RR_{main}) + var(\ln VR_{main}) follows assumption correlation mean variance.

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Formula: lnCVRinter=ln(CVAB/CVBCVA/CVCtrl)+12(12(nAB−1)−12(nA−1)+12(nB−1)−12(nCtrl−1))\ln CVR_{inter} = \ln\left( \frac{CV_{AB} / CV_{B}}{CV_{} / CV_{Ctrl}} \right) + \frac{1}{2} \left( \frac{1}{2(n_{AB} - 1)} - \frac{1}{2(n_{} - 1)} + \frac{1}{2(n_{B} - 1)} - \frac{1}{2(n_{Ctrl} - 1)} \right) Sampling variance: var(lnCVRinter)=var(lnRRinter)+var(lnVRinter)var(\ln CVR_{inter}) = var(\ln RR_{inter}) + var(\ln VR_{inter}) follows assumption correlation mean variance.

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: functions compute effect sizes treatment × time interactions longitudinal studies, comparing experimental control groups change time.

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Computes standardized mean difference interaction experimental treatment time. Formula: d=((X‾t1,Exp−X‾t1,Ctrl)−(X‾t0,Exp−X‾t0,Ctrl))Spooled⋅Jd = \frac{((\bar{X}_{t1,Exp} - \bar{X}_{t1,Ctrl}) - (\bar{X}_{t0,Exp} - \bar{X}_{t0,Ctrl}))}{S_{pooled}} \cdot J Time-specific pooled standard deviation: Spooled=((nExp−1)(sdt0,Exp2+sdt1,Exp2)+(nCtrl−1)(sdt0,Ctrl2+sdt1,Ctrl2))2(nExp+nCtrl−2)S_{pooled} = \sqrt{\frac{((n_{Exp} - 1)(sd_{t0,Exp}^2 + sd_{t1,Exp}^2) + (n_{Ctrl} - 1)(sd_{t0,Ctrl}^2 + sd_{t1,Ctrl}^2))}{2(n_{Exp} + n_{Ctrl} - 2)}} Sampling variance: var(d)=2(1−rExp)nExp+2(1−rCtrl)nCtrl+d22(nExp+nCtrl)var(d) = \frac{2(1 - r_{Exp})}{n_{Exp}} + \frac{2(1 - r_{Ctrl})}{n_{Ctrl}} + \frac{d^2}{2(n_{Exp} + n_{Ctrl})} rExpr_{Exp} rCtrlr_{Ctrl} correlations time points within group.

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Formula: lnRR=ln(X‾t1,Exp/X‾t1,CtrlX‾t0,Exp/X‾t0,Ctrl)\ln RR = \ln\left(\frac{\bar{X}_{t1,Exp} / \bar{X}_{t1,Ctrl}}{\bar{X}_{t0,Exp} / \bar{X}_{t0,Ctrl}}\right) Sampling variance: var(lnRR)=(sdt0,Exp2X‾t1,Exp2+sdt1,Exp2X‾t0,Exp2−2rExpX‾t0,ExpX‾t1,Expsdt0,Expsdt1,Exp)nExpX‾t0,Exp2X‾t1,Exp2+var(\ln RR) = \frac{(sd_{t0,Exp}^2 \bar{X}_{t1,Exp}^2 + sd_{t1,Exp}^2 \bar{X}_{t0,Exp}^2 - 2r_{Exp} \bar{X}_{t0,Exp} \bar{X}_{t1,Exp} sd_{t0,Exp} sd_{t1,Exp})}{n_{Exp} \bar{X}_{t0,Exp}^2 \bar{X}_{t1,Exp}^2} +(sdt0,Ctrl2X‾t1,Ctrl2+sdt1,Ctrl2X‾t0,Ctrl2−2rCtrlX‾t0,CtrlX‾t1,Ctrlsdt0,Ctrlsdt1,Ctrl)nCtrlX‾t0,Ctrl2X‾t1,Ctrl2\frac{(sd_{t0,Ctrl}^2 \bar{X}_{t1,Ctrl}^2 + sd_{t1,Ctrl}^2 \bar{X}_{t0,Ctrl}^2 - 2r_{Ctrl} \bar{X}_{t0,Ctrl} \bar{X}_{t1,Ctrl} sd_{t0,Ctrl} sd_{t1,Ctrl})}{n_{Ctrl} \bar{X}_{t0,Ctrl}^2 \bar{X}_{t1,Ctrl}^2}

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Formula: lnVR=ln(sdt1,Exp/sdt1,Ctrlsdt0,Exp/sdt0,Ctrl)\ln VR = \ln\left(\frac{sd_{t1,Exp} / sd_{t1,Ctrl}}{sd_{t0,Exp} / sd_{t0,Ctrl}}\right) Sampling variance: var(lnVR)=(1−rExp2)nExp−1+(1−rCtrl2)nCtrl−1var(\ln VR) = \frac{(1 - r_{Exp}^2)}{n_{Exp} - 1} + \frac{(1 - r_{Ctrl}^2)}{n_{Ctrl} - 1}

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Formula: lnCVR=ln(CVt1,Exp/CVt1,CtrlCVt0,Exp/CVt0,Ctrl)\ln CVR = \ln\left(\frac{CV_{t1,Exp} / CV_{t1,Ctrl}}{CV_{t0,Exp} / CV_{t0,Ctrl}}\right) Sampling variance: var(lnCVR)=var(lnRR)+var(lnVR)var(\ln CVR) = var(\ln RR) + var(\ln VR)

what: Effect sizes for Meta-analysis of interactions
title: Effect sizes for Meta-analysis of interactions
text: Factorial designs help us understand synergies antagonisms ecological factors. However, meta-analyses factorial experiments rare ecology, likely extracting effect sizes factorial data straightforward. minter R package simplifies process providing functions extract different effect sizes factorial data, enabling researchers conduct meta-analyses interactions factors.

title: Effect sizes for Meta-analysis of interactions
code: devtools::install_github("fdecunta/minter")

title: Effect sizes for Meta-analysis of interactions
code: library(minter)  # Dummy data from 8 studies examining fertilization × drought on plant biomass studies <- data.frame(   study_id = 1:8,   # Control: No fertilization, well-watered   Ctrl_mean = c(12.3, 15.7, 10.8, 14.2, 11.9, 13.5, 16.1, 12.7),   Ctrl_sd   = c(2.1, 3.2, 1.8, 2.7, 2.3, 2.9, 3.5, 2.4),   Ctrl_n    = c(20, 24, 18, 22, 19, 25, 23, 21),   # Fertilization only   Fert_mean = c(18.5, 21.3, 16.2, 19.8, 17.1, 20.4, 22.7, 18.9),   Fert_sd   = c(3.1, 4.1, 2.7, 3.6, 3.2, 3.8, 4.2, 3.4),   Fert_n    = c(22, 25, 20, 24, 21, 26, 25, 23),   # Drought only     Drought_mean = c(8.7, 11.2, 7.9, 10.1, 8.3, 9.8, 11.7, 9.4),   Drought_sd   = c(1.8, 2.4, 1.6, 2.1, 1.9, 2.3, 2.6, 2.0),   Drought_n    = c(19, 23, 17, 21, 18, 24, 22, 20),   # Both treatments   Both_mean = c(14.2, 17.8, 12.9, 16.3, 13.7, 16.1, 18.4, 15.2),   Both_sd   = c(2.9, 3.7, 2.5, 3.3, 2.8, 3.4, 3.9, 3.1),   Both_n    = c(21, 26, 19, 23, 20, 27, 24, 22) )  # Calculate interaction effect: Does fertilization work differently under drought? interaction_results <- lnRR_inter(   data = studies,   Ctrl_mean = "Ctrl_mean", Ctrl_sd = "Ctrl_sd", Ctrl_n = "Ctrl_n",   A_mean = "Fert_mean", A_sd = "Fert_sd", A_n = "Fert_n",    B_mean = "Drought_mean", B_sd = "Drought_sd", B_n = "Drought_n",   AB_mean = "Both_mean", AB_sd = "Both_sd", AB_n = "Both_n" )  head(interaction_results) #>   study_id Ctrl_mean Ctrl_sd ... yi        vi #> 1        1      12.3     2.1     0.081  0.0069 #> 2        2      15.7     3.2     0.158  0.0068 #> 3        3      10.8     1.8     0.084  0.0073  #> # Negative values = antagonistic interaction (fertilization less effective under drought)  # Meta-analysis library(metafor) res <- rma(yi, vi, ..., data = interaction_results)
